alert.note: Alert for Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 4:08PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Big Horn County through 445 PM MDT... At 406 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Pryor, or 32 miles north of Lovell, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail, along with very heavy rain. Small hail may accumulate on the ground. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Big Horn County, in the vicinity of the Pryor Mountains. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn
